title: Input lag in client
body: So I've had this problem ever since the new client began, and you've been telling me (Riot) to use the Hextech Repair Tool to fix my problem, but I've done that more times than I can count, and it's not helped. I've sent logs to Riot Support, but to my knowledge they haven't replied, and it's been a few months. Anyways, I know it's packet loss, and I've added firewall exceptions and am using public DNS, but nothing it working. If you want my logs I'll do that when I can.

replies.body:
I know it was almost a month ago, but it looks like you're still having the same kind of packet loss issue I was trying to help you with before. I never got a response on what the log reader said about your network logs, so let's start there again. 

Grab your latest network logs from a game that had that input lag and let our [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) scan them. Take a screenshot of what it says and post it here for me to go over with you.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=ToMy7EgQ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-01T04:26:58.339+0000)
>
> I know it was almost a month ago, but it looks like you're still having the same kind of packet loss issue I was trying to help you with before. I never got a response on what the log reader said about your network logs, so let's start there again. 
> 
> Grab your latest network logs from a game that had that input lag and let our [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) scan them. Take a screenshot of what it says and post it here for me to go over with you.

My client has input lag, not in game. In game I have a tiny bit, but ever since I changed to Public DNS, I haven't had ingame input lag. Should I take the same logs?

Update: Just put it through the log reader. Says ping was 33 stable with a few spikes to 36. Packet loss was 0% the entire game.

> [{quoted}](name=Mxepc Sentrik,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=ToMy7EgQ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-08-01T07:10:34.479+0000)
>
> My client has input lag, not in game. In game I have a tiny bit, but ever since I changed to Public DNS, I haven't had ingame input lag. Should I take the same logs?
> 
> Update: Just put it through the log reader. Says ping was 33 stable with a few spikes to 36. Packet loss was 0% the entire game.

Thanks for the snappy reply. Now that I've lost a game to an AFK toxic jungler, a toxic support, and a toxic mid laner, I very much want to not play this game. Thanks for fixing this issue while I wanted to participate in this game that obviously needs a few matchmaking kinks worked out. This is the 5th game in a row where people have flamed me. Thanks, Riot.
